titleStmt.title: The country lass for me, give me the bonny country lass, take you the girls o'th city, the country girls do them surpass, though London girls are witty: the country girls in honesty, do citizens surpass, then once again I do proclaim, none like the country lass. The tune is, Hey boys up go we.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby, in West-smithfield.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Come lovers all, both great and small ..."
Place, date of publication, and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
